detaileddescription.para: In most case, authentication information consists of a username and password. If realm isn't set, it will be deduced automatically from the first authentication challenge as for the hash algorithm. Sometimes, a userid is required by the proxy and then domain can be useful to discriminate different credentials. You can also use this object if you need to use a client certificate.
Once created and filled, a LinphoneAuthInfo must be added to the LinphoneCore in order to become known and used automatically when needed. Use linphone_core_add_auth_info() for that purpose.
The LinphoneCore object can take the initiative to request authentication information when needed to the application through the authentication_requested() callback of it's LinphoneCoreCbs.

The application can respond to this information request later using linphone_core_add_auth_info(). This will unblock all pending authentication transactions and retry them with authentication headers.

briefdescription.para: Adds authentication information to the LinphoneCore.

detaileddescription.para:
That piece of information will be used during all SIP transactions that require authentication.
core
The LinphoneCore.
info
The LinphoneAuthInfo to add.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneCore from which the LinphoneAuthInfo will be removed.

briefdescription.para: Returns an unmodifiable list of currently entered LinphoneAuthInfo.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *core, const char *realm, const char *username, const char *sip_domain)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_find_auth_info

briefdescription.para: Find authentication info matching realm, username, domain criteria.

detaileddescription.para:
First of all, (realm,username) pair are searched. If multiple results (which should not happen because realm are supposed to be unique), then domain is added to the search.
core
the LinphoneCore
realm
the authentication 'realm' (optional)
username
the SIP username to be authenticated (mandatory)
sip_domain
the SIP domain name (optional)
a LinphoneAuthInfo if found.

briefdescription.para: Setup a new digest authentication policy applicable for SIP and HTTP.

detaileddescription.para:
Setup a new digest authentication policy applicable for SIP and HTTP.
core
the LinphoneCore
policy
a LinphoneDigestAuthenticationPolicy

briefdescription.para: Get the current digest authentication policy applicable for SIP and HTTP.

detaileddescription.para:
Get the current digest authentication policy applicable for SIP and HTTP.
core
the LinphoneCore
The current digest authentication policy.

memberdef.argsstring: (LinphoneCore *core, const char *username, const char *userid, const char *passwd, const char *ha1, const char *realm, const char *domain)
memberdef.name: linphone_core_create_auth_info

briefdescription.para: Create an authentication information with default values from Linphone core.

parameterdescription.para: String containing the username part of the authentication credentials
String containing the username to use to calculate the authentication digest (optional)
String containing the password of the authentication credentials (optional, either passwd or ha1 must be set)
String containing a ha1 hash of the password (optional, either passwd or ha1 must be set)
String used to discriminate different SIP authentication domains (optional)
String containing the SIP domain for which this authentication information is valid, if it has to be restricted for a single SIP domain.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *username, const char *userid, const char *passwd, const char *ha1, const char *realm, const char *domain)
memberdef.name: linphone_auth_info_new

briefdescription.para: Safely cast a belle_sip_object_t into LinphoneAuthInfo.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *username, const char *userid, const char *passwd, const char *ha1, const char *realm, const char *domain, const char *algorithm)
memberdef.name: linphone_auth_info_new_for_algorithm

briefdescription.para: Instantiates a new auth info with values from source.

parameterdescription.para: The LinphoneAuthInfo object to be cloned.

briefdescription.para: Take a reference on a LinphoneAuthInfo.
Sets the available algorithms list without testing unicity.

parameterdescription.para: The available algorithms list. const char *

briefdescription.para: Add an unique algorithm in the the available algorithms list : Algorithms that already exist will not be added.
Sets the domain for which this authentication is valid.

parameterdescription.para: The domain. This should not be necessary because realm is supposed to be unique and sufficient. However, many SIP servers don't set realm correctly, then domain has to be used to distinguish between several SIP account bearing the same username.

briefdescription.para: Remove all algorithms from the available algorithms list.

simplesect.para: A list of available algorithms. const char *

briefdescription.para: Check if Authinfos are the same without taking account algorithms.

simplesect.para: TRUE if all fields (Username, UserId, Realm, Domain) are the same.

briefdescription.para: Set whether MD5 hash algorithm is allowed.

detaileddescription.para:
The default value is TRUE, in order to maximize interoperability. MD5 is considered as a weak algorithm, some might want to disable it, in which case SHA-256 will be required to perform digest authentication.
policy
The LinphoneDigestAuthenticationPolicy object.
value
a boolean value.

briefdescription.para: Get whether MD5 hash algorithm is allowed.

detaileddescription.para:
The default value is TRUE, in order to maximize interoperability. MD5 is considered as a weak algorithm, some might want to disable it, in which case SHA-256 will be required to perform digest authentication.
policy
The LinphoneDigestAuthenticationPolicy object.
a boolean value

briefdescription.para: Set whether digest authentication without 'qop=auth' mode is allowed.

detaileddescription.para:
The default value is TRUE, in order to maximize interoperability. 'qop=auth' mode enforces security thanks to the use of a client nonce, which makes password brute forcing more difficult. When set to FALSE, linphone will refuse to authenticate to servers that are not implementing the qop=auth mode.
policy
The LinphoneDigestAuthenticationPolicy object.
value
a boolean value.

briefdescription.para: Get whether digest authentication without 'qop=auth' mode is allowed.

detaileddescription.para:
The default value is TRUE, in order to maximize interoperability. 'qop=auth' mode enforces security thanks to the use of a client nonce, which makes password brute forcing more difficult. When set to FALSE, linphone will refuse to authenticate to servers that are not implementing the qop=auth mode.
policy
The LinphoneDigestAuthenticationPolicy object.
a boolean value

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the user pointer associated with the LinphoneDigestAuthenticationPolicy object.
Assign a user pointer to the LinphoneDigestAuthenticationPolicy object.
